item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Saturday, December 14, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Helix: Why (And How) I Use It (39 points | 30 comments)
2. In search of a faster SQLite (4 points | 1 comment)
3. Majjit LSP (58 points | 25 comments)
4. Luon high-level programming language similar to Oberon+, integrating concepts from Lua, and targeting the LuaJIT VM (11 points | no comments)
5. 3 shell scripts to improve your writing, or "My Ph.D. advisor rewrote himself in bash." (53 points | 22 comments)
6. Security Review for Mullvad VPN (11 points | no comments)
7. SCCS roach motel (20 points | 1 comment)
8. A deep dive into modern Windows Structured Exception Handler (SEH) (3 points | no comments)
9. Auth bypass in Go SSH package (17 points | 10 comments)
10. Ki, a multi-cursor structural editor (16 points | 2 comments)
11. 0x01 - Killing Windows Kernel Mitigations (1 points | no comments)
12. Less talk, more code (16 points | 13 comments)
13. Garbage Collected Smart Pointers in Rust via Concurrent Cycle Collection (6 points | 4 comments)
14. When Your Webcam Doesn’t Work: Solving Firefox and PipeWire Issues (12 points | 3 comments)
15. The Jujutsu version control system (65 points | 40 comments)
16. WebTransport (WebSockets 2.0) talk at RubyConf (5 points | 3 comments)
17. Algorithms for high performance terminal apps (10 points | no comments)
18. A new video captures a remarkable 1968 demo of IBM’s Executive Terminal (11 points | 1 comment)
19. "Rules" that terminal programs follow (61 points | 38 comments)
20. Oxidised causal inference in software design (3 points | 3 comments)
21. C++ exception performance three years later (16 points | no comments)
22. When should we require that firmware be free? (16 points | 1 comment)
23. markitdown: Python tool for converting files and office documents to Markdown (2 points | no comments)
24. What are you doing this weekend? (5 points | 15 comments)
25. The Humble For Loop in Rust (16 points | 9 comments)
